Recap: Starr and Cole are on the road and on the run. Blair and Todd discover that she is gone. They know that Langston knows where she is and they shake it out of her. She admits that Starr and Cole left last night. Adriana, Layla and Dorian arrange for Brody to come to Llanview and put him up in a room at the palace. But when they check on him the following morning, they discover a woman in his bed. They brainstorm about finding a way to get him to reunite with Gigi and Shane. But he doesn't seem to buy what they tell him and he only wants to drink. Everybody is very surprised that Calvin Jenkins no longer wants to oppose B.E. Dorian threatens him for betraying her. But he's not worried. She figures out that Viki was probably behind the decision he made to reconcile with the Buchanans.
Transcript: Blair: You know, you took some great shots last night, but I think this one's my favorite. You like it?
Todd: No, it's all right.
Blair: No, it looks great. I think we should blow it up and put it in a frame.
Todd: Yeah. You should blow it up and replace that ugly picture of Dorian at the top of the stairs.

Blair: You are so unobservant -- just like a man. That picture of Dorian has been down for six months, ever since we've lived here. But, you know, I like this one. It was such a great night last night. Wasn't it --
Todd: Yeah.
Blair: All of us together?
Todd: Yeah. As far as I remember, it was pretty nice when it was just the two of us, too.
Blair: Ooh, it was. Hey, good morning, Langston.
Langston: Hi.
Blair: Hi. Where's your partner in crime this morning?
Langston: Oh, Starr? Um -- she's up-- still upstairs sleeping. Yeah.

[Music plays]
Starr: Do you think one cup of coffee would hurt the baby?
Cole: I don't think a gallon of this stuff would.

Cole: Hmm. Hey, come on, take a sip. I mean, you deserve it.
Starr: No, it's okay. I'm not the one who's been driving.
Cole: Yeah, but you've been keeping me company -- and awake, which is really important when driving.

Rex: Oh, well.

Adriana: Layla, that's why we got the extra key card.
Layla: You know, I feel a little weird about barging into the hotel room of some strange man, especially someone like Brody.
Adriana: Look, Layla, I don't want Brody screwing things up before I get him back together with Gigi.
Layla: I know that, but --
Adriana: He drank the entire stash of bourbon and beer on the jet last night. He's probably still passed out.

Layla: Oh, my God -- ahem.

Shane: So then, Super Brody turns Evelyn Evil into a crow.
Viki: Well, she had it coming, didn't she?

Viki: They really are, you know. If you're interested, I could introduce you to some cartoon illustrators. Maybe you could watch them work.

Viki: Oh, good.

Charlie: Come on, he's just proud of his dad. There's nothing wrong with a kid being proud of his old man. Ah.
Viki: I love watching you with Shane. You are so sweet. Doesn't it make you think about what you missed with your own son?
Charlie: Well, I think Rex and I are slowly catching up.
Viki: Yeah, I meant the other one.
Charlie: Oh.
Viki: Are you really sure there's no way that you could have a relationship with him?
Charlie: Hey. You know, he made it pretty clear that he didn't really want to be any part of my life.
Viki: I find it so hard to imagine that anyone could say that to you.
Charlie: Well, thank you, but I'm afraid that's the way things are right now, and maybe someday, someday soon if I'm lucky, we'll be able to be a real father and son again.

Jared: Just do it! Thank you.

Nigel: Mr. Jenkins informed Mr. Buchanan that he is ending his quest for Buchanan Enterprises.
Jared: You're kidding. Well -- well, how did Clint and Bo manage that?
Nigel: According to them, they did nothing. Mr. Jenkins changed his mind for reasons known only to himself.

Gigi: Yes.

Natalie: Actually, everything's great.
Viki: Oh.

Natalie: Calvin Jenkins did a 180 and he is not going after B.E. now.

Natalie: I don't know. It wasn't a "what," it was "who."

Calvin: No, he's got nothing -- nobody's buying me off, either.
Dorian: Oh. I'll make you regret this.

Dorian: You wouldn't part with that stock. You are bluffing.

Jared: That's Mr. Buchanan.

Nigel: Indeed.
Jared: Huh -- who knows? Maybe -- maybe he's the guardian angel that persuaded Jenkins to think twice before going into battle with B.E.
Nigel: May I say something, Sir?
Jared: Have I ever stopped you before?

Nigel: Mr. Buchanan was understandably proud of his company, his empire. He built it from the ground up as you well know. But, believe it or not, there was something more important to him than Buchanan Enterprises, something he fought for harder than he even fought for money.
Jared: Let me guess -- the family.
Nigel: Actually, I was going to say love.

Natalie: Okay. Mom, you have to tell me -- what did you say to Calvin Jenkins to make him change his mind?

Viki: I know.

Viki: I don't really think you and I can be pointing fingers where that particularly quality is concerned.

Natalie: I guess I got a double dose of stubbornness.

Viki: Honey, listen, we're not going to say anything to your father about this and Calvin isn't going to, either, okay? Calvin had a momentary lapse in judgment, but he's a good man. I would just like to know who was the one who put him up to trying to take down B.E. in the first place.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dorian: It is Viki. Ah-oh! Well, why does it surprise me? And Clint went crawling to her for help.

Dorian: This isn't personal. I'm a businesswoman.
Calvin: Well, you can lie to me, you can lie to yourself, do whatever we want to do, but I think you should do yourself a favor -- I think you should let it go.

Calvin: Oh, this worm is going to mosey on somewhere else before he gets eaten. I'll see you, gorgeous.

Blair: You make me very happy.

Cole: Because I want to surprise you.
Starr: Okay, well, why can't we take one of these interstates or something?

Cole: And that's what he called them, too.

Adriana: That's not good. No one can know that Brody is here.
Layla: Well, I wouldn't worry about it too much. The amount she drank would wipe out anybody's memory and, you know, from what I can see, she doesn't look like the communicative type. Just get here.
Brody: Talking to your pretty friend?
Layla: You mean Adriana?
Brody: Ah, pretty name for a pretty girl -- nice kisser, too, a lot better than that one. She can't hold her liquor, either.

Brody: Hey, I didn't pick her up -- she's from the room across the hall, all right? We met at the ice machine. She's in town for a convention.

Brody: You know, I don't have a clue.

Jared: Your point, Nigel?
